title: Visa processing timesVisa processing times
summary: This page provides median visa processing times for key Australian visa categories as of October 2025. It explains factors that cause variations in processing times and outlines how users can view detailed processing information for their specific visa applications.

structured_data.overview: The Department aims to improve visa processing times while maintaining program integrity. Processing times can vary significantly based on application completeness, external checks, program place availability, and other factors.
reasons_for_processing_time_variation: Whether applications include all necessary supporting documents
Whether applications are lodged online or on paper; online applications help streamline processing
How quickly applicants respond to requests for further information
Time required to obtain information from external agencies, particularly for health, character, and national security checks
For permanent visas, the number of places available in the migration program
Fluctuations in the number of visa applications
Deciding older applications increases processing times

skilled_permanent.comments: Focus on reducing processing times across all permanent visas. Processing both new and older applications may cause monthly fluctuations as the oldest cases are progressed.

partner_provisional_temporary.comments: Efforts are focused on reducing times for Partner visas, particularly older and complex cases. This will affect monthly processing statistics as the oldest applications are finalised.

skilled_temporary.comments: Processing time reductions are a priority. Incomplete applications requiring additional information cause delays. Simultaneous lodgement of nomination and visa applications is encouraged. Focus also includes older and complex applications, affecting monthly averages.

student.comments: Applications lodged outside Australia are processed according to Ministerial Directions. Lodged before 14 November 2025: Ministerial Direction 111. Lodged on or after 14 November 2025: Ministerial Direction 115. Applicants should lodge well ahead of course commencement with complete documentation.

visitor.comments: Includes subclasses 600, 601, and 651. For subclass-specific times, refer to the global processing times guide.

ministerial_directions_for_student_visas.notes: Student visa applications lodged outside Australia follow these directions.

how_to_view_processing_times.instructions: Applicants can view processing time information using the visa processing times guide.
how_to_view_processing_times.update_frequency: Processing times are updated regularly as new data becomes available.
exceptions: Visas that are closed to new applications
Family visas that are capped and queued
Visas with too few decisions in the month to provide reliable processing time indicators

recommendations_for_faster_processing: Submit all necessary supporting documents at the time of application
Where possible, lodge nomination and visa applications simultaneously (for relevant visa types)
